content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron Plate Production (Position 0,0 and 2,0)
Two parallel smelting setups consisting of:
- Stone furnaces at (0,0) and (2,0)
- Both furnaces processing iron ore into iron plates
- Each furnace has coal fuel and produces iron plates

### Copper Plate Production (Position 4,4)
Single smelting setup consisting of:
- Stone furnace at (4,4)
- Processing copper ore into copper plates
- Has coal fuel and actively working

### Electronic Circuit Production Line (Position 6.5-12.5, y=11.5)
Assembly line consisting of:
- Input wooden chest at (6.5, 11.5) containing iron plates and copper cables
- Burner inserter at (7.5, 11.5) moving materials from input chest to assembling machine
- Assembling machine 1 at (9.5, 11.5) crafting electronic circuits
- Burner inserter at (11.5, 11.5) moving finished circuits to output chest
- Output wooden chest at (12.5, 11.5) storing electronic circuits

### Power Generation System (Around x=-7 to -2.5, y=22.5-26.5)
Power setup consisting of:
- Offshore pump at (-9.5, 24.5) producing water
- Pipe network connecting water from pump to boiler
- Boiler at (-7.0, 24.5) converting water to steam
- Steam engine at (-2.5, 24.5) generating electricity
- Connected pipe network moving steam between components
- Electric pole network distributing power

### Science Pack Processing (Around x=0.5, y=28.5-31.5)
Science setup consisting of:
- Lab for research
- Burner inserter at (0.5, 30.5) feeding science packs
- Input chest at (0.5, 31.5) storing automation and logistic science packs

ERROR TIPS

### Fuel Management Errors
- Monitor coal levels in boiler to prevent "out of fuel" errors
- Keep sufficient coal in inventory before attempting to refuel structures

### Assembly Machine Resource Management
- Ensure consistent supply of all required ingredients (copper cable shortage noted)
- Monitor input chest resource levels to maintain continuous production

### Power System Management
- Maintain constant fuel supply to boiler to prevent power interruptions
- Monitor steam levels and temperature in the power generation system
